name: TheAtlantic
text: "Immigration into the United States allows multicultural interactions that produce Americans who can see the country from both within and without," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/ZNaE1YrxHw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Catherine O’Hara, who plays the bombastic matriarch in "Schitt’s Creek," has won this year’s Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series.

In 2019, @aawicks wrote about the character’s aspirational fabulousness. https://t.co/AzCsNdqHkI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There is no such thing as a singular Latino electorate. There are only Latino electorates, which vary by state, gender, generation, economic status, and their family's nation of origin," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/bHYrkyJjZy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This advice may sound strange, but anyone who cares about the future of the Supreme Court needs to speak as little as possible about the Supreme Court," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/WgWGxhNFKr

name: TheAtlantic
text: The actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, who won an Emmy tonight for his performance in “Watchmen,” discussed the show's reimagining of his character as a Black man in a 2019 interview with @shirklesxp. https://t.co/H2ZfcZcj1f

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Requiring religious people in the ordinary course of their lives to follow the rules that apply to everyone else is not hostility; it is equality," Howard Gillman and Erwin Chemerinsky write: https://t.co/RnTRigN2b2

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As many New Yorkers have discovered since the start of the pandemic, our mayor has not demonstrated the ability to manage large-scale operations or the energy to get things done," @gracerauh writes: https://t.co/dIO60ifRLm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Zendaya, who stars in HBO's "Euphoria," has become the youngest to win the Emmy for lead actress in a drama.

In 2019, @sophiegg wrote about her "ability to quickly shift modes, communicating both Rue’s cynical, hardened edges … and her vulnerability.”https://t.co/V6b5XuLofj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Succession," HBO’s satirical dramedy about a Murdochesque media empire, won this year’s Emmy for best drama series. In 2019, @megangarber analyzed the show’s “gross physicality.” https://t.co/veQa1ToNYW
